replies.bodyText:
This is true, but the Signature on the SignableXMLObject will still be null.
So you can keep working with the OpenSAML layer objects (because they have a copy of the DOM element with the signature), but it's confusing because the OpenSAML model is no longer an accurate reflection of the DOM state (one has signature data, the other doesn't).
I prefer to reflect that by returning Element because that is the only model that clearly reflects the newly attached signature.
replies.author: tvernum
